intro: Afrosciadium articulatum, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clustered inflorescences, which are followed by bright red berries. Afrosciadium articulatum is often found in moist, shady environments such as forests and along riverbanks. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in some African communities.
